sen.j: 嵯峨野線（さがのせん）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の京都駅～園部駅間の愛称である。
sen.e: Sagano Line (Sagano-sen) is a popular name for the portion of the San-in main line (JR West Japan Railway) between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station..
The Sagano Line (Sagano-sen) is the nickname for the portion of the San-in main line (JR West Japan Railway) between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station.
sen.cmt: 最初の「Line」から欠けられた「i」と、「Sagano」の前に「The」を挿入して、「Popular name」がちょっと意味不明ですので同じ意味をする「Nickname」にしました。
sen.e: The Sagano Line (Sagano-sen) is the nickname for the portion of the San-in main line (JR West Japan Railway) between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station.
sen.cmt: スペース削除

sen.j: この愛称は1988年3月13日から使用されている。
sen.e: This popular name has been used since March 13, 1988.
This nickname has been in use since March 13, 1988.
sen.cmt: 「Popular name」→「Nickname」、「Has been used」→「Has been in use」
sen.e: This nickname has been in use since March 13, 1988.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 本来の名称である山陰線と併せて嵯峨野山陰線、山陰嵯峨野線と案内されることもある。
sen.e: It is also introduced in some tourist information as Sagano San'in Line or San'in Sagano Line, which were derived from its original name San'in Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also introduced in some tourist information as the Sagano San'in Line or the San'in Sagano Line, names derived from its original name, the San'in Line.
sen.cmt: 「The」を線路名前の前に挿入しまして、「which were derived from its」→「Names derived from its」
sen.e: It is also referred to in some tourist information as the Sagano San-in Line or the San-in Sagano Line, names derived from its original name, the San-in Line.
sen.cmt: 慣用表現。 “introduced”->”referred to”

sen.j: これは島根県・鳥取県の山陰地方両県が「山陰」の名を案内に残すように要望したためといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that this is because both prefectures of Shimane Prefecture and Tottori Prefecture in the San'in region demanded the name "San-in" to be included in the tourist information.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is said to be because both Shimane Prefecture and Tottori Prefecture in the San'in region demanded that the name "San-in" be included in the tourist information.
sen.cmt: 「It is said that this is because」→「This is said to be because」、「prefectures of」を削除しました。
sen.e: This is said to be because both Shimane Prefecture and Tottori Prefecture in the Sanin region demanded that the name "San-in" be included in the tourist information.
sen.cmt: San'in→Sanin

sen.j: ラインカラーは紫（■）であり、選定理由は「京の優雅さをイメージ」とされている。
sen.e: The line color is purple (), with the selection consideration being "Elegance is the old capital's image".
The line color is purple (), chosen with 'the image of the elegance of the old capital' in mind.
sen.cmt: 「with the selection consideration being, “Elegance is the old capital's image".」→「chosen with 'the image of the elegance of the old capital' in mind.」
sen.e: The line color is purple (), chosen with 'the image of the elegance of the old capital' in mind.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 基本的に快速列車が毎時1本、普通列車が毎時3本ほど運転され（うち2本は京都～亀岡駅間の区間運転）、一部は胡麻駅や福知山駅まで直通運転されている。
sen.e: Basically, there is one Rapid train per hour; about three Local trains per hour (two of which are running between Kyoto Station sand Kameoka Station), with some direct trains going as far as Goma Station or Fukuchiyama Station.

As a rule, there is one rapid train and approximately three local trains per hour (two of which run between Kyoto Station and Kameoka Station), with some direct trains going as far as Goma Station or Fukuchiyama Station.
sen.cmt: 「per hour; about three」→「and approximately three」、「which are running」→「which run between」、「sand」→「and」
sen.e: As a rule, there is one rapid train and approximately three local trains per hour (two of which run between Kyoto Station and Kameoka Station), with some direct trains going as far as Goma Station or Fukuchiyama Station.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またアーバンネットワーク内で唯一、他の路線から直通する定期普通列車が存在しない。
sen.e: Moreover, it is the only existing regular local train that goes directly from other routes in the Urban Network (JR West).
In addition, it is the only line in the Urban Network (JR West) with no direct regular local trains from other lines.
sen.cmt: GRAMMAR, MISTRANSLATION
sen.e: In addition, it is the only line in the Urban Network (JR West) with no direct regular local trains from other lines.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 観光地として人気のある嵯峨野・嵐山方面へのアクセスとしての利用が盛んであり、紅葉シーズンには、京都～嵯峨嵐山駅間に臨時列車も運転される。
sen.e: As it is frequently used as the access to the popular sightseeing spots in the direction of Sagano-Arashiyama, during the red maple season, additional trains are run between Kyoto and Saga-Arashiyama.
As it is frequently used as the access to popular sightseeing spots in the direction of Sagano-Arashiyama, additional trains are run between Kyoto and Saga-Arashiyama during the red maple season.
sen.cmt: 「the」削除、「during the red maple season」箇所異動
sen.e: As it is frequently used to access popular sightseeing spots in the direction of Sagano-Arashiyama, additional trains are run between Kyoto and Saga-Arashiyama stations during the red maple season.
sen.cmt: スタイルの問題。 “ as the access to” -> “to access”

sen.j: また定期列車の増結運転も行われる。
sen.e: Moreover, regular trains are run more frequently.
Moreover, regular trains are run more frequently.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Additionally, regular trains are run more frequently.
sen.cmt: 意味不明。 “Moreover”->”Additionally”

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道時代の山陰本線はあくまでも長距離特別急行列車や長距離普通列車を中心に運行され、京都近郊の通勤通学需要が殆ど考慮されていなかった。
sen.e: During the Japanese National Railways age, the San-in main line was mainly run as long distance Limited Express trains or long distance local trains almost exclusively. The demand of commuting schools from Kyoto outskirts was hardly considered.

During the Japanese National Railways age, the San-in main line was used almost exclusively by long-distance limited express trains or long-distance local trains, and the demand of the commuter schools on the outskirts of Kyoto was hardly considered.
sen.cmt: 「almost exclusively」箇所異動、「commuting」→「commuter」、「from Kyoto outskirts」→「on the outskirts of Kyoto」
sen.e: During the Japanese National Railways age, the San-in main line was used almost exclusively by long-distance limited express trains or long-distance local trains, and the demand created by those commuting to school or work from the outskirts of Kyoto was hardly considered.
sen.cmt: 左記緑部分：「通勤通学」が含まれるように修正しました。 「Office」はいつも職場を示して、この言葉を使うと単数形/複数形の問題が入ります。「Work」のほうは職場か仕事かを示すので、その問題を逃れます。

sen.j: その後1987年の国鉄分割民営化によりJR西日本発足。
sen.e: Then in1987, Japan National Railway was breakup due to privatization and JR West was originated from that.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, in 1987, the Japan National Railway was broken up by privatization and JR West was created.
sen.cmt: 「Then in 1987」→「Then, in 1987」、「breakup」→「broken up」、「was originated from that」→「was created」
sen.e: Then, in 1987, the Japan National Railway was broken up by privatization and JR West was created.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この区間では1989年の嵯峨（現・嵯峨嵐山）～馬堀駅間の複線とそれに伴うトンネル経由の新線への切り替えられた。
sen.e: In 1989, this portion of the railway was switched to the new line passing through the double-track line (and the accompanying tunnel) between Saga (present Saga Arashiyama) and Umahori Station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1989, this section of the railway was switched to a new line passing through the double-track line (and the accompanying tunnel) between Saga (present Saga Arashiyama) and Umahori Station.
sen.cmt: 「portion」→「section」、「the」→「a」
sen.e: In 1989, this section of the railway was switched to a new line passing through the double-track line (and the accompanying tunnel) between Saga (present Saga Arashiyama) and Umahori Station.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1990年の京都～園部間の電化
sen.e: In 1990, the trains between Kyoto and Sonobe were changed to electricity-run.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1990, the trains between Kyoto and Sonobe were converted to electric trains.
sen.cmt: 「were changed to electricity-run」→「were converted to electric trains」
sen.e: In 1990, the trains between Kyoto and Sonobe were converted to electric trains.
sen.cmt: 訳文のスペース削除

sen.j: 1996年の二条駅～花園駅 (京都府)間の高架化完成など順を追って路線の近代化がなされ、国鉄時代からは大きく変貌を遂げたことにより、沿線開発も進んだといえる。
sen.e: With the sequential completion such as the elevation of the portion between Nijo Station and Sonobe Station (Kyoto Prefecture), the route was much modernized and it has undergone a drastic transfiguration from its appearance of the Japanese National Railways age.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The route was modernized and completed in stages, including the elevation of the portion between Nijo Station and Sonobe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) in 1996, and it has undergone a drastic transformation from its appearance in the Japanese National Railways age.
sen.cmt: 「With the sequential completion such as the」→「The route was modernized and completed in stages, including the」、「in １９９６」挿入、「the route was much modernized and it has」→「and it has」、「transfiguration」→「transformation」
sen.e: It can be said that branch-off railway tracks were expanded with the route modernization and completion in stages, including the elevation of the portion between Nijo Station and Sonobe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) in 1996, and it has undergone a drastic transformation from its appearance in the Japanese National Railways age.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。

sen.j: また京都市内において1989年に太秦駅、2000年に円町駅がそれぞれ新設され、需要を開発している。
sen.e: And within the Kyoto City, Uzumasa Station and Emmachi Station were established newly established respectively in 1989 and 2000. Demand is being developed.
Within Kyoto City, Uzumasa Station was built in 1989, followed by Emmachi Station in 2000, and demand is being created.
sen.cmt: 「And」削除、「Uzumasa Station and Emmachi Station were established newly established and 2000.respectively in 1989 and 2000.」→「Uzumasa Station was built in 1989, followed by Emmachi Station in 2000,」、「Demand is being developed」→「and demand is being created．」
sen.e: Within Kyoto City, Uzumasa Station was built in 1989, followed by Emmachi Station in 2000, and demand is being created.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし現在でも単線区間が多く残ることなどから、特急列車を除くと、毎時3～4本の運転がありながら、昼間のみならず夕方のラッシュ時にさえ30分強もの間隔で列車が運転されている時間帯があり、不均衡なダイヤとなっている。
sen.e: However, because a lot of single-track regions still remain, excluding the Limited Express trains, while there are 3 to 4 trains per hour during the daytime, during the evening rush hours, there are time zones during which people have to wait more than 30 minutes for trains. The train schedule is very unbalanced.

However, the train schedule is very unbalanced; because a lot of single-track regions still remain, while there are 3 to 4 trains per hour during the day, excluding the limited express trains, there are time slots during which people have to wait more than thirty minutes for trains, even during the evening rush hours.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻して、文を再構成しました。「even」を挿入しました。
sen.e: However, the train schedule is very unbalanced; because a lot of single-track regions still remain, while there are 3 to 4 trains per hour, excluding the limited express trains, there are time slots during which people have to wait more than thirty minutes for trains, not only during the day but also during the evening rush hours.
sen.cmt: 昼間のみならずのかかる位置がずれているためduring the dayの位置を移動even→but also

sen.j: 従ってまだまだ大都市圏の都市交通の機能を担うには満足な運行形態とはなっていないという感は否めない。
sen.e: Therefore, it cannot be denied that the running operation is kind of much far from satisfying the urban traffic function in a metropolitan area.
Therefore, it is undeniable that the operating pattern is far from fulfilling metropolitan area urban traffic functions in a satisfactory manner.
sen.cmt: 「it cannot be denied」→「it is undeniable」、「running operation」→「operating pattern」、「is kind of much far from satisfying the urban traffic function in a metropolitan area．」→「is far from fulfilling metropolitan area urban traffic functions in a satisfactory manner.」
sen.e: Therefore, it is undeniable that the operating pattern is far from fulfilling metropolitan area urban traffic functions in a satisfactory manner.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また園部駅以北は本数が少なくなる上に特急との格差も年々大きくなってきている。
sen.e: Moreover, with the decrease in the trains in the north of Sonobe Station, the difference with the Limited Express trains is growing every year, too.
Moreover, with the decrease in trains north of Sonobe Station, the gap between regular trains and limited express trains is growing every year, too.
sen.cmt: 「in the north」→「north」、「difference」→「gap」
sen.e: Moreover, with the decrease in trains north of Sonobe Station, the gap between regular trains and limited express trains is growing every year, too.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 今後、2010年春を目処に嵯峨野線全区間の完全複線化を予定している。
sen.e: It is scheduled that in the future that double-track lines in all portions of Sagano Line are to be completed by spring 2010.
All sections of the Sagano Line are scheduled to be converted to double-track lines by the spring of 2010.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。
sen.e: All sections of the Sagano Line are scheduled to be converted to double-track lines by the spring of 2010.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現在その工事が進行中であるが、当初の全面完成予定の2009年春からは約1年程度遅れが生じる見込みである。
sen.e: Though the construction is progressing now, the originally planned completion in 2009 spring is expected to be delayed for about 1 year.
The construction is currently underway, but it was originally planned to be completed by the spring of 2009, and is now a year behind schedule.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。
sen.e: The construction is currently underway, but it was originally planned to be completed by the spring of 2009, and is now a year behind schedule.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またこの事業と同時に、附帯事業として、花園～太秦間の高架化がなされる。（2008年3月下旬完成済み）
sen.e: As an affiliated business along with this business, the elevation of the portion between Sonobe and Uzumasa was completed in late March 2008.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As an accessory task accompanying this work, the elevation of the track between Sonobe and Uzumasa was completed in late March 2008.
sen.cmt: 「an affiliated business along with this business」 →「an accessory task accompanying this work」、「portion」→「track」
sen.e: As an additional task accompanying this work, the elevation of the track between Sonobe and Uzumasa was completed in late March 2008.
sen.cmt: 意味不明瞭。. “accessory” →“additional”

sen.j: 嵯峨嵐山駅および亀岡駅では、駅の橋上化と自由通路の設置工事も進行中。
sen.e: In Saga Arashiyama Station and Kameoka Station, the reconstruction of the stations on top of a bridge and the installation construction of free passages are in progress, too.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Saga Arashiyama Station and Kameoka Station are both currently being reconstructed on bridges, and pedestrian passages are being installed.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。「free passages」→「pedestrian passages」
sen.e: Saga Arashiyama Station and Kameoka Station are both currently being reconstructed on bridges, and pedestrian passages are being installed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これら2駅の橋上化に関しては予定通り2008年春に完成する予定である。
sen.e: Concerning the reconstruction of the 2 stations on top of a bridge, it is scheduled to be completed in spring 2008.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The reconstructed bridge-top stations are set to be completed on schedule in spring 2008.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。
sen.e: The reconstructed bridge-top stations are set to be completed on schedule in spring 2008.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これに併せ、自動列車停止装置の導入が計画されている。
sen.e: Accompanying this, the introduction of automatic train stop is planned.
In addition, the introduction of automatic train stop is planned.
sen.cmt: 「Accompanying this」→「In addition」
sen.e: In addition, the introduction of an automatic train stopping system is planned.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。意味不明。 “the introduction of automatic train stop”→“the introduction of an automatic train stopping system is planned”

sen.j: また、臨時列車では行われていた丹波口駅～梅小路駅間の短絡線を活用したJR京都線大阪駅方面との相互直通運転案が近畿地方交通審議会で検討されている。
sen.e: Moreover, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport has been examining the proposal of a mutual direct train service in the Osaka direction of JR Kyoto Station, which utilizes the short track between Tambaguchi Station and Umekoji Station with additional trains.

Moreover, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport is examining a proposal for a bilateral direct train service with the Osaka direction of the JR Kyoto Station, which utilizes the shunt track between Tambaguchi Station and Umekoji Station for additional trains.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。「mutual」→「bilateral」、「short track」→「shunt track」
sen.e: Moreover, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport is examining a proposal for a bilateral direct train service with the Osaka Station direction of the JR Kyoto Line, which utilizes the shunt track between Tambaguchi Station and Umekoji Station for additional trains.
sen.cmt: the Osaka direction of the JR Kyoto Station→the Osaka Station direction of the JR Kyoto Line

sen.j: 運転本数が増えたことにより、特に京都～二条付近の高架区間において騒音問題が浮上しているが、まだ抜本的な解決策はない。
sen.e: With the increase of the running trains, especially in the elevated region between Kyoto and the vicinity of Nijo, noise problems have become evident. However, there is no drastic measure yet.

With the increase in trains, noise problems have begun to surface, especially in the elevated region between Kyoto and the vicinity of Nijo; however, there have been no sweeping countermeasures as yet.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。「become evident」→「begun to surface」、「drastic measure」→「sweeping countermeasureｓ」
sen.e: With the increase in trains, noise problems have begun to surface, especially in the elevated region between Kyoto and the vicinity of Nijo; however, there have been no sweeping countermeasures as yet.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嵯峨野線の全ての駅でJスルー・ICOCA及び東日本旅客鉄道（JR東日本）などのSuica、東海旅客鉄道（JR東海）のTOICA、またスルッとKANSAIのPiTaPaが使用できる。
sen.e: At all the stations in the Sagano Line, J Thru ICOCA card, Suica card of East Japan Railway (JR East Japan Railway), TOICA card of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and PiTaPa (Postpay IC for Touch and Pay) card of Surutto KANSAI Pass can be used.

The J Thru ICOCA card, the Suica card of East Japan Railway (JR East Japan Railway), the TOICA card of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and the PiTaPa (Postpay IC for Touch and Pay) card of Surutto KANSAI Pass can be used at all stations on the Sagano Line.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入、再構成しました。
sen.e: The J Thru ICOCA card, the Suica card of East Japan Railway (JR East Japan Railway), the TOICA card of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and the PiTaPa (Postpay IC for Touch and Pay) card of Surutto KANSAI Pass can be used at all stations on the Sagano Line.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この路線の競争相手として京阪京都交通（旧・京都交通 (亀岡)）による、国道9号を経由して京都市内（京都駅、阪急京都本線桂駅）と亀岡およびその以西とを結ぶ路線バスが存在する。
sen.e: As a rival to this railway, there exists shuttle buses by Keihan Kyoto Kotsu Corporation (former Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka)), that utilize the National Highway 9 in connecting Kyoto City and Kameoka (including its west).

Shuttle buses run by the Keihan Kyoto Kotsu Corporation (formerly Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka)) which utilize National Highway 9 to connect Kyoto City and Kameoka and parts west exist as competition for this railway.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。「its west」→「parts west」
sen.e: Shuttle buses run by the Keihan Kyoto Kotsu Corporation (formerly Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka)) which utilize National Highway 9 to connect Kyoto City (Kyoto Station and Hankyu Kyoto Line Katsura Station) and Kameoka and parts west exist as competition for this railway.
sen.cmt: (Kyoto Station and Hankyu Kyoto Line Katsura Station) 補足

sen.j: Jrの駅では通常駅本屋側のホームを1番のりばとする。
sen.e: A JR station usually has the first platform next to the main station building as terminal 1.
JR stations usually have the first platform next to the main station building as Terminal 1.
sen.cmt: 「A JR station usually has」→「JR stations usually have」、「terminal 1」→「Terminal 1」
sen.e: JR stations usually have the first platform next to the main station building as Platform 1.
sen.cmt: 「No.番線、のりば」の表記を統一

sen.j: 嵯峨野線区間の各駅（京都駅除く）は駅本屋の位置にかかわらず、上り線側のホームを1番のりばとしている。
sen.e: However, each station (except for Kyoto Station) along Sagano Line has the first platform toward Kyoto as terminal 1, regardless of the position of the main station building.
However, each station along the Sagano Line (except for Kyoto Station) has its first Kyoto-bound platform as Terminal 1, regardless of the position of the main station building.
sen.cmt: （except for Kyoto Station）箇所異動、「the」挿入、「the first platform toward Kyoto」、「its first Kyoto-bound platform」
sen.e: However, each station along the Sagano Line (except for Kyoto Station) has its first Kyoto-bound platform as Platform 1, regardless of the position of the main station building.
sen.cmt: 「No.番線、のりば」の表記を統一

sen.j: （但し駅によっては一線スルーのために1番のりばから下り列車が出ることもある）
sen.e: Depending on the station, because of passing through, trains sometimes are running away from Kyoto though.
Depending on the station, though, because a line is run through, sometimes trains which leave from Terminal 1 are traveling away from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。「because of passing through」→「because a line is run through」
sen.e: At some stations, however, a train may pass through the station without stopping, so sometimes trains that run on the tracks that pass by Platform 1 are traveling away from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: I can't see why "のりば" has been translated as "terminal". Surely this means platform? A terminal is something else entirely. The above translation is a little 意訳 but the meaning is fairly unambiguous. Please check.
